page.title: 07Local Transport
page.content: Eighty Four per cent of those who leave the area to work travel by car & only 6% by bus. However many of the old & young still depend on public transport. A bus runs from Stevenage to Walkern 3 times a day (not Sundays) & both London & Country and Smiths, a private company, provide a limited service to Stevenage, Hitchin & Hertford 3 days a week. There is concern that if the service is curtailed further some sections of the community would suffer real hardship. As few houses in Walkern have garages there is concern about parking in the High Street & about weight & speed of traffic in a village environment.There is a growing demand for a pedestrian crossing & carpark. The lack of public transport in one way fosters communtiy spirit. Improved British Rail services to London has facilitated commuting.
